did.unittitle: Philadelphia Club of Advertising Women records

bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Club of Advertising Women was founded in 1916 to foster the careers of women in the advertising business. The group held regular meetings, sponsored courses for its members, raised funds for various philanthropic and patriotic organizations, and funded scholarships, including one at the Charles Morse Price School of Advertising and Journalism.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the records of the Philadelphia Club of Advertising Women. Materials include minutes of the Board of Directors, Nominating Committee, and dinner meetings; the bylaws and charter; membership records; financial reports; copies of Adland News; programs for annual dinner dances; programs and records related to the Eastern Conference of Women's Advertising Clubs; scrapbooks, photographs, and ephemera. Also included are records related to the association's various civic and philanthropic activities.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
